<RESUME_START>
FINANCE COORDINATOR

SUMMARY

To acquire a position that will grant me the opportunity to contribute to the efficient operation of a firm and earn advancement through my job performance.
Highlights
Accounting systems assessment Account reconciliations Budget analysis General and tax accounting
Accounts receivable professional Fiscal budgeting knowledge Invoice coding familiarity Strong communication skills General ledger accounting skills Multi-state payroll ADP Federal and state tax regulations Record-keeping I-9 documentation Accounts payable Internal controls Microsoft applications Billing Independent worker Time management Attention to detail Exceptionally organized Relationship building
Reliable Excellent communication skills Bilingual in [Spanish] Flexible Excellent time management skills

ACCOMPLISHMENTS

Accounting Skills
Operated computers programmed with accounting software to record, store, and analyze information.
General Ledger Accounts
Maintained accurate accounts including cash, inventory, prepaid, fixed assets, accounts payable, accrued expenses and line of credit transactions.

EXPERIENCE


06/2010 to Current
Finance Coordinator
Company Name
Responsible for the preparation of bi-weekly payroll including retirement plans, termination, union dues as well as resolving insurance issues and deductions for 30+ employees using the Paychex system.
Maintained and entered time-keeping data for collected bi-weekly timesheets into Paychex Time and Labor system with particular focus on processing exempt & non-exempt hours, personal, vacation & sick leave.
Applied knowledge of applicable laws as related to the payroll process, including garnishment regulations, and state tax regulations.
Reviewed payroll reports for accuracy prior to distribution of pay checks.
Maintained an accounts payable turnover rate of 30 days or less.
General ledger posting.
Prepared bank reconciliation.
State and City Funding Monthly Expense Reports.

09/2007 to 03/2010
Accountant
Company Name
— City , State
Responsible for the preparation of bi-weekly payroll including retirement plans, termination, as well as resolving insurance issues and deductions for 175 employees using the ADP TotalSource and ADP PC.
Maintain and enter time-keeping data for collected bi-weekly timesheets into ADP EZ Labor Management system with particular focus on processing exempt & non-exempt hours, personal, vacation & sick leave.
Apply knowledge of applicable laws as related to the payroll process, including garnishment regulations, and state tax regulations.
Review payroll reports for accuracy prior to distribution of pay checks.

04/1994 to 10/2006
Senior Accountant
Company Name
－
City
Responsible for the preparation of bi-weekly payroll including retirement plans, termination, union dues as well as resolving insurance issues and deductions for 550+ employees using the ADP system.
Maintained and entered time-keeping data for collected bi-weekly timesheets into ADP system with particular focus on processing exempt & non-exempt hours, personal, vacation & sick leave.
Applied knowledge of applicable laws as related to the payroll process, including garnishment regulations, and state tax regulations.
Reviewed payroll reports for accuracy prior to distribution of pay checks.
Interacted with employees and management on payroll related projects and inquiries including reporting of employee leave of absence, unemployment, fund allocations, payroll account reconciliation, disability and worker's compensation on a monthly and quarterly basis.
Maintained and monitored all government contracts, grants and restricted contributions to ensure all reporting requirements are met on a timely basis and review on-going budgetary discrepancies with program directors.
Prepared annual audit schedules, budgets and various financial analyses as needed.
Maintained an accounts payable turnover rate of 30 days or less.
General ledger posting.
Prepared bank reconciliation.
Successfully managed over ten state and city contracts, including preparing monthly expenditure reports, budget modifications, and year end closeouts.
Maintained account receivable analysis reports.

SKILLS

Payroll, State Tax, Accounts Payable, Bank Reconciliation, General Ledger, Posting, Reconciliation, Accountant, Account Receivable, Account Reconciliation, Accounting, Billing Audit, Basis, Budget, Budgets, Compensation, Contracts, Disability, Government Contracts, Leave Of Absence, Payroll Account, Payroll Account Reconciliation, Finance, Excel, Microsoft Windows Xp, Ms Excel, Ms Word, Outlook, Quickbooks, Quickbooks Pro, FUND EZ, Paychex, ADP, Medical Invoicing.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Accounting Specialist

Location: Greater Madison Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: 
Position SummaryWe are looking for an accounting specialist who is conscientious, detail-oriented and a team player. The accounting specialist will be responsible for daily accounting tasks, including processing debits & credits, journal entries, store billings, etc. In addition, the accounting specialist will carry out relevant administrative duties (e.g. responding to clients via email and handling invoices). 
Essential Job FunctionsProcess debit and credit memos, shortages, allowance claims and merchandise returnsAnalyze and verify information by creating spreadsheet reportsRespond to information requests from customersProcess check runs and electronic paymentsPrepare, verify and post journal entries in accordance with GAAP standardsMaintain personal auto usage for tax reporting purposesAssist with audit preparationProcess weekly store billingsRecord non-inventory payablesAnalyze current procedures and recommend changes to develop and implement best practice accounting proceduresPerform other accounting, financial, or administrative tasks as assigned by Senior Accountant, Controller or CFOIs regular in attendance and complies with the Company Attendance PolicyCompetenciesStrong computer and data entry skills, including MS outlook, word, excel and teamsAbility to multi-task to ensure deadlines are metDetail oriented and thorough Excellent communication skills both written and verbalAbility to work with minimal supervisionMust be able to maintain confidentiality
Education and ExperienceAssociate degree or High School graduate2-3 years of accounting experienceCertco is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. 



PIbf9dafae0bbc-29463-34285383

Description:
Certco, Inc headquartered in Madison, Wisconsin is looking for an experienced Accounting Specialist. Are you a detail-oriented individual with a knack for numbers and a passion for teamwork? Are you looking to take the next step in your accounting career with a dynamic and collaborative team? If so, we want you to join us as our newest Accounting Specialist!  What You'll Do:Process daily accounting tasks, including debits and credits, journal entries, and store billings, with a keen eye for detail and accuracy.Collaborate with team members to reconcile accounts, resolve discrepancies, and ensure the integrity of financial data.Assist with relevant administrative duties, such as responding to client inquiries via email, handling invoices, and maintaining organized records.Contribute to the development and implementation of efficient accounting processes and procedures to streamline operations and improve accuracy.Work closely with cross-functional teams to support financial reporting requirements and meet deadlines.Why Join Certco, Inc.? 2024 Top WorkplaceCertco has been recognized as a Top Workplace in Wisconsin by the Wisconsin State Journal for 2024!
This award reflects our commitment to fostering a positive and supportive work environment. Our culture, which is built on teamwork, integrity and passion, sets us apart. As we move forward, we will continue to invest in our people and maintain our top workplace status. 
Our Accounting Specialist role offers:Competitive salaryVoted Madison's 2024 Top Workplace Premium low-cost insurance, including health, dental, vision, life insurance, and short/long-term disability.Generous 401k match, profit sharing, and paid time off.Robust wellness program with gym reimbursement, chair massages, on-site fitness center and weekly on-site chiropractic care to name a few of the amenities we provide.Sponsorship of walks, runs, sports teams, and exciting company events like picnics, Christmas parties, and pro soccer games.Amazing company culture!We are a company that invests in and believes in our employees. Every team member is valued equally, fostering a culture where everyone feels important. We deeply appreciate the diverse experiences and skills our staff brings to the company. For our dedicated team, we offer not only a robust benefits package but also an incredible company culture and ample opportunities for professional advancement.
About Certco, Inc.We are a wholesale grocery distributor dedicated to supporting small business grocers comprehensively. As an all-in-one company, we handle our clients' grocery deliveries, IT needs, accounting services, and provide advertising/marketing support while serving as trusted consultants. While groceries are at the heart of our business, our offerings extend far beyond. Since our inception in 1930, we have expanded to multiple warehouse locations, servicing over 200 stores across Wisconsin, Illinois, Minnesota, and Iowa. Our daily commitment is to provide the services and insights necessary for our clients to thrive, be more successful, and enjoy valuable time with their families.
If you are ready to make a significant impact within our supply chain operations, apply today and become part of the Certco family!

Compensation details: 22-24 Hourly Wage

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
<JD_END>
